item.title: Parsing Elf and Dwarf Files on Linux with the Zig Standard Library: Part 1
item.description: Background Recently, I’ve been pretty into debuggers. With the recent development of the RAD Debugger Project, RemedyBG’s continued existence, and smaller projects like Spray, I became interested in how they work under the hood. So I set out to try to craft a (simple) debugger on my own. Unfortunately, I decided to start at the harder part of crafting a debugger, parsing ELF and DWARF. Ok, to be fair, they are not ESPECIALLY difficult, but there is a severe lack of resources available on the subject (please correct me if I’m wrong here).

item.title: The Tmux Guide I Wish I Had
item.description: GENERAL: tmux: start session exit: leave session default prefix key: ctrl-b copy mode: prefix + [ select area to copy: ctrl-v + space PANES: contain individual terminal sessions only one active at a time vsplit: ctrl-b + % hsplit: ctrl-b + “ change window: ctrl-b + <up, down, left, right move pane: ctrl-b + { or } select pane by number: ctrl-b + q + [PANE_NUMBER] zoom into pane: ctrl-b + z make pane a window: ctr-b + !

item.title: Font and SDF Rect Rendering With Zig and WGPU
What Ive Been Practicing - 001
item.description: A Little Background Since coming home from school, I’ve had a lot more time to practice the drums (yay)! For context, I’ve been playing the drum set since 7th grade. I started off learning West African drumming, the steel pans and even traditional Japanese taiko drumming. In high school, I played in Jazz Band, Gospel Band, Symphonic Band, and even the marching band as a snare drummer. I thought I would not play in college, but I was convinced by a friend of mine to audition for an on-campus, R&B/Jass/Hip-Hop group called “Love, and a Sandwich.

item.title: Howdy, world!
item.description: Howdy, world. My name is Bryson Miller, and this is my personal website. Here I will be discussing topics in the fields of programming, music, and health. Since I just graduated from college, I have a lot more free time now. I also have lot of thoughts™. This blog will mainly serve as a one-off dumping ground for any interesting problems/solutions or ideas that I’ve come across while going about my day job or hobby projects.

item.title: About
item.description: Bryson Miller: Software Engineer based in SF. Interested in low-level programming, performance, systems. Outside of programming I love drumming and working out. Find me on GitHub (code) and Youtube (long form educational content). Powered by Hugo using the Basics theme.
